Dave,

Currently equilibrium with consensed phases is not supported. It is a
fairly simple modification to include a single pure phase; let me look
and see if there is a quick fix. The presence of *multiple* condensed
phases can cause some numerical problems for the algorithm used. In
fact, this 'element potential' algorithm is not well-suited for
multiphase problems, although it is very fast for the single-phase case.

To do an equilibrium calculation specifying only the elemental
composition, simply give as input any composition that has the desired
elemental composition. The equilibrium composition depends only on the
elemental composition and the values of the two properties held
constant. You can even specify the initial state is composed of atomic
H, C, O, and N in the right proportions. (You would probably want to
hold T, P constant in this case.)

There is no plug flow model, but if you don't want to include a pressure
drop then you can use the zero-D reactor model, and map the time to
position by dx = v(x)dt. Of course, it would be better to have a model
that takes care of this for you. It is not hard to write - I'll try to
include it in the next release.

Dave
